review: For $35 this purchase is a no brainer. I ordered this the day it was announced, received it 2 days later with prime shipping and have used it every day since then with absolutely no problems.  When the device was first introduced it worked with only certain Google Apps and Netflix, but now its compatibility has expanded to many other services like HBOgo, HuluPlus, Pandora, Plex, Avia, ReadyPlayer, and many more.  It's easy enough to set up, that I take it with me when i go to friends houses or on vacation, and honestly use it more than I watch cable TV anymore.  If I had more than one TV in my apartment I'd buy one for each TV I would own,  Do yourself a favor an go ahead and place this order, you wont regret it!
author: K. Youngs

review: After I plugged it in I was able to stream from the Utube app and the Netflix app directly without any problems and with great video image in less than 5 minutes.  The delay is due to the Chromecast updating its software.  I have it plugged into a Yamaha V-671 amp so I can switch from cable to DVD to Chromecast using the Yamaha remote, which I use anyway to control sound (or the Yamaha app).  Connection is through our wireless network.  The router is in a different room, without line of sight, but this does not seem to affect the quality of the video or sound.  No buffering issues at all.  The installation instructions appeared on the TV once I chose the right HDMI input on the Yamaha amp.  I cast from an ipad (without cellular connection) and a Droid Maxx phone, both worked equally well.  Given the negative comments I read last year about limited performace, I am very pleasantly surprised.  This little gadget does what it should, and it does it well.  Cudos to Google.
